attributes.action: e-Democracy: Give Us A Vote On Issues And/Or Power Of Veto
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the quality of our Democracy will be vastly improved by the introduction of more input from the actual people it is designed to serve.

I believe that we crossed the technological threshold needed for providing universal access to decision-making long ago. The two main barriers of Cost and Time-Efficiency are now an irrelevance as the apparatus is already in place, so it is time to give serious attention to how best to leverage it for the principles of Participatory Democracy to most fully serve us all.

I would like to request Parliament devote resources and time to researching and discussing the ideas, as outlined at TheClickRevolution.co.uk to upgrade our system.

We need the power to Veto unpopular decisions, as a minimum, to address this need.
